title: AI Pre-Flight Checklist - Possible Minds
content: AI Pre-Flight Checklist - Possible Minds CEO CHECKLIST AI Pre-Flight Checklist The essential questions every SME CEO should answer before investing in AI agents Think of these as runway lights â if they're not all green, the AI agent project shouldn't take off yet. 0% 1 What's the business problem, not the tech wish? Can I clearly name a single pain point or KPI I want to move in the next 6â12 months? Is it worth solving even without AI? I have a clearly defined business problem with measurable impact I have a general idea but need to define it more precisely I'm exploring AI because it's trendy, not for a specific problem 2 Do we have a measurable success target? What does "done" look like? Can we measure it in hard numbers (time saved, revenue gained, errors reduced)? Clear metrics and success criteria are defined Some metrics identified but need refinement No clear success metrics defined yet 3 Is my data accessible and trustworthy? Do we know where the relevant data lives and who owns it? Is it clean, current, and legally safe to use? Data is organized, accessible, clean, and compliance-ready Data exists but needs cleanup or better organization Data is scattered, poor quality, or legally unclear 4 Do I have the people and time to run a pilot? Who will own the project and be accountable for results? Who will review and approve AI outputs during early stages? Dedicated project owner and review team assigned Some resources available but need to formalize roles No clear ownership or available bandwidth 5 Can we afford to learn? What's my maximum budget for a 6â8 week experiment (time + money)? Am I comfortable if the pilot only produces learning, not ROI? Budget allocated with expectation of learning over immediate ROI Some budget available but need to manage expectations Budget requires immediate ROI or is severely limited 6 Are there low-risk, high-impact use cases to start with? Can I find at least one process that's repetitive, rules-based, and measurable? Will automating or assisting in this process create visible wins for the team? Multiple low-risk, high-impact processes identified Some potential processes but need validation Struggling to identify suitable starting processes 7 Do we understand the risks? What's the worst-case scenario if the AI makes a mistake here? Will it damage customers, compliance, or brand trust? Risks thoroughly assessed with mitigation strategies in place Basic risk assessment done but need more detailed planning Haven't fully considered potential risks and consequences Check My Readiness Ready! Your AI Readiness Assessment Based on your responses, here's your readiness status: Get Your Personalized Action Plan We'll send you a detailed roadmap with next steps and best practices tailored to your readiness level. markdown:
CEO CHECKLIST

#  AI Pre-Flight Checklist

The essential questions every SME CEO should answer before investing in AI agents 

Think of these as runway lights â if they're not all green, the AI agent project shouldn't take off yet. 

0%

1

## What's the business problem, not the tech wish?

Can I clearly name a single pain point or KPI I want to move in the next 6â12 months? Is it worth solving even without AI?

I have a clearly defined business problem with measurable impact 

I have a general idea but need to define it more precisely 

I'm exploring AI because it's trendy, not for a specific problem 

2

## Do we have a measurable success target?

What does "done" look like? Can we measure it in hard numbers (time saved, revenue gained, errors reduced)?

Clear metrics and success criteria are defined 

Some metrics identified but need refinement 

No clear success metrics defined yet 

3

## Is my data accessible and trustworthy?

Do we know where the relevant data lives and who owns it? Is it clean, current, and legally safe to use?

Data is organized, accessible, clean, and compliance-ready 

Data exists but needs cleanup or better organization 

Data is scattered, poor quality, or legally unclear 

4

## Do I have the people and time to run a pilot?

Who will own the project and be accountable for results? Who will review and approve AI outputs during early stages?

Dedicated project owner and review team assigned 

Some resources available but need to formalize roles 

No clear ownership or available bandwidth 

5

## Can we afford to learn?

What's my maximum budget for a 6â8 week experiment (time + money)? Am I comfortable if the pilot only produces learning, not ROI?

Budget allocated with expectation of learning over immediate ROI 

Some budget available but need to manage expectations 

Budget requires immediate ROI or is severely limited 

6

## Are there low-risk, high-impact use cases to start with?

Can I find at least one process that's repetitive, rules-based, and measurable? Will automating or assisting in this process create visible wins for the team?

Multiple low-risk, high-impact processes identified 

Some potential processes but need validation 

Struggling to identify suitable starting processes 

7

## Do we understand the risks?

What's the worst-case scenario if the AI makes a mistake here? Will it damage customers, compliance, or brand trust?

Risks thoroughly assessed with mitigation strategies in place 

Basic risk assessment done but need more detailed planning 

Haven't fully considered potential risks and consequences 

Check My Readiness 

Ready!

## Your AI Readiness Assessment

Based on your responses, here's your readiness status:

## Get Your Personalized Action Plan

We'll send you a detailed roadmap with next steps and best practices tailored to your readiness level.

Email Address

Company Name (Optional)

I'd like to receive updates about AI strategy insights and implementation best practices 

Send My Action Plan
